hackathon-description-text: is the second collegiate hackathon hosted by California State University, Long Beach! During our 24 hour event, student developers and designers will gather on campus to build and program ideas into reality. Whether you join a team or go solo, join us at BeachHacks and show us what makes

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Project and Development Practices from Full David Experience
Best use of Server-less Technology, UI/UX, and API Usage from FriendBuy

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $2000 scholarship to any domestic Summer Academy location & Make School Tee for each member of your team
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best iOS Hack from Make School

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $2000 scholarship to any domestic Summer Academy location & Make School Tee for each member of your team
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Beginner Hack from Make School

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Have the best Domain name and get Domain.com swag bags.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1250 N Bellflower Blvd, Long Beach, CA 90815, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How creative is your hack? Try to approach the problem you are trying to solve from a novel angle!
How usable is your hack in its current state? Strive to create a functioning project even if it doesn't have a ton of features!
How does it look? How was it implemented? We will be looking at your overall design practices: back-end and front-end!

hackathon-location-address: 1250 N Bellflower Blvd, Long Beach, CA 90815, USA
hackathon-description-header: The California State University Long Beach Hackathon.
